definition: to drill/to bore/to get into/to make one's way into/to enter (a hole)/to thread one's way through/to study intensively/to dig into/to curry favor for personal gain
to guard against/to exhort/to admonish or warn/to give up or stop doing sth/Buddhist monastic discipline/ring (for a finger)

sentences.english: Rosie's diamond ring sparkled in the sunlight.
sentences.chinese: 萝西的钻戒在阳光下闪闪发光。

sentences.english: The diamond ring was soused into the fishbowl of water.
sentences.chinese: 那只钻戒被扔进了养鱼缸的水里。

sentences.english: A classic emerald-cut diamond set in platinum creates a dramatic presence.
sentences.chinese: 经典的祖母绿切割铂金钻戒展现前所谓有的迷人风采。

sentences.english: She wears a diamond ring around her slim third finger.
sentences.chinese: 她纤长的无名手指上戴着一枚钻戒。

sentences.english: Frieda's engagement ring is a diamond set in gold.
sentences.chinese: 费丽达的定婚戒指是镶金钻戒。

sentences.english: The diamond ring glittered on his finger.
sentences.chinese: 钻戒在她的手指上闪闪发光。

sentences.english: “In the past year, the retro look in diamonds has been very popular, ” says Eve Goldberg, co-owner of William Goldberg Diamond Corporation, which produced the custom-designed ring.
sentences.chinese: 在过去，这种复古样式的钻戒设计是相当受欢迎的。

sentences.english: Eu ni put pearl ring into the sea, but present illusion and nightmares.
sentences.chinese: 薇妮把珍珠钻戒丢进海里，但却呈现幻觉和做恶梦。

sentences.english: I wish to buy a diamond ring, too.
Some rich women splurge on diamond rings and mink coats.
sentences.chinese: 有些富婆在钻戒和貂皮外套上挥霍金钱。

sentences.english: He was hocus-pocussed into buying an artificial diamond ring.
sentences.chinese: 他受骗买了一只假钻戒。

sentences.english: Marry played her big diamond ring around the office for show.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽在办公室里玩弄着她的钻戒炫耀给大家看。

sentences.english: If that diamond ring turns to brass, Papa's gonna buy you a looking-glass.
sentences.chinese: 如果钻戒变成了废铜，爸爸就会给你买镜子。

sentences.english: The actress showed off her new engagement ring at the Grammys.
sentences.chinese: 她也一脸幸福地在格莱美展示钻戒。

sentences.english: Going by her diamond ring,she must be very rich.
sentences.chinese: 从她的钻戒判断，她一定很富有。

sentences.english: A guy bought his wife a beautiful diamond ring for Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 圣诞节一个男人为他的妻子买了一只漂亮的钻戒。

definition: small diamonds/melee (small diamonds used in embellishing mountings for larger gems)/splints (sharp-pointed diamond splinters)/clatersal (small diamond splints from which diamond powder is produced by crushing)
famous watch (i.e. expensive brand of wristwatch)
